title: In Othello, Shakespeare achieves 'unity of action' through Iago, who weaves all the characters into his web. What was the extent to which you agree with this statement? - Quora

response.answer_text: Unless you mean “unity of action” in the sense of the “neoclassical unities,” then it is a legitimate, common-sense claim that Iago holds the drama together by interacting with each of the characters, as well as being the villain of the plot, and occasional narrator of the action through his many asides and soliloquies.
